pros: Good place to learn and grow
cons: Pay. High level admin disconnected from the reality of the daily job. Inflexible and establish rules without fully understanding the impact of those rules.

pros:
if you want bosses that don't give two sh*ts about your safety then thats a pro.
OH! Or the kids that hit you, and then being told its your fault. If you like things to be your fault then this is a great place to work.
cons:
everything, training is terrible. Kids will punch, kick and beat you. Basically most people have to leave early once a week to go to the hospital due to injuries, then you are told "why didn't you block it", then they contest your workers comp and make you go to court. 
this place is literal hell.

job_title: Behavioral Health Associate in Cincinnati, OH
pros: working with some of the kids can be awesome
cons: No structure to the program, bad management, poor communication between staff and administration.

job_title: Teacher, Elementary School in Cincinnati, OH
pros: The freedom to teach whatever you want. No body checks on you, ever.
cons: No structure. When something is said it isn’t followed through. When something is done wrongfully the person of wrong doing is not held accountable. The people making decisions HAVENT been on the floor in very many years and don’t know the current reality. Seems higher ups don’t care for staff well being; mental or physical.

job_title: Mental Health Counselor in Cincinnati, OH
pros: If you have a passion for working with children this is a good place to start
cons: Very corporate ran, productivity driven feel

pros: Hard work is acknowledged and growth opportunities are available.
cons: Large caseloads make for high burnout and turnover

pros:
- Promote Trauma Informed Care
- Constantly growing to ensure our agency improves, learning from past mistakes
- Compassionate staff
- Kids are great, they have been through a lot but they are my super heroes
- I have a voice
- Advancement opportunities and growth happens quickly if you work for it
- Great benefits
- Great Leadership
- Flexible Schedule
- Learn so much!
cons:
- It is hard work. It's not for everyone.  The work really pulls at my heart strings and can test you at times...that's also what makes it so rewarding.  But my faith in God and the self care team is making great efforts to help.
- There had been a lot of change by the state which made our ways change/adapt.  During that time there was a lot of turnover... but we really lost the people not willing to put in the effort.  We still held on to some amazing people and people who deserved supervisor roles were promoted.
- No other cons, it is a wonderful place to work

review_title: Find Someplace Better, Where You'll Be Appreciated
pros:
Some of the people are very nice,
You bond with parents and the children.
Occasionally you get a chance to join on the fun of the talent shows and carnivals that the children put on.
cons:
Management of the medical department and the scheduler there are a complete mess. And care more about protecting themselves than actually looking out for their patients.
They pay is on the very low end of the scale.
You only get raises (or a step up in our title that comes with higher pay) if your a brown noser and super close with the supervisor. 
The are "subtly" racist.
The turnover rate is very high.

job_title: Behavioral Health Specialist in Cincinnati, OH
pros: Cannot really think of any
cons: Where do I begin? The management is horrible, everything is disorganized. They promise you will always be protected when children go into crisis but leave you alone to fend for yourself. You do not get paid near as much as you should be, and you only get $250 of your $500 bonus in the beginning. If you are sick, doctors notes even are not allowed, so do not get sick, ever. The units (kitchen and bedrooms) are disgusting, and staff never cleans them. Have witnessed staff pulling children around. The "friends" of the group gang up on other staff members and lie about things to make you feel dumb. The children are not being helped at all, they are just being babysat.

job_title: Mental Health Specialist in Cincinnati, OH
pros: Helping the kids through tough times can be rewarding. For the most part coworkers worked together. Benefits. Hours.
cons: Kids get rewarded no matter how bad their behavior. You would think you're in high school because of how immature some employees are, SO MUCH GOSSIP!  Upper management DOES NOT care about employees. It's all about how many kids they can pack into that place and how much money they can make.  Upper management gets all of the money while those working directly with the kids get choked, punched, chairs thrown at them and cursed out, all while making little money. This place is a joke that's why the turnover rate is the way it is. Not many people stay there longer than 6 months. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND TO ANYONE!

pros: Adaptable to change, always looking for ways to better serve kids and families, opportunities for growth.  I wish I could give the 6 month business outlook a triple thumbs up as I know we've been working hard to prepare for the changes that are coming.
cons: Direct Care staff are not paid what they are worth.  They have the most face to face time with our kids, and are paid the least.

pros: It is amazing when you see clients succeeding and the pride it brings them and their families.
cons: High caseloads. Lots of documentation and paperwork expected. Not enough time each week to see all clients. Not always feasible to do notes in session as they expect of you. Seems like they just continue to add work to your already high caseload. When you take time off you’re still required to meet UR hours. So even if you want vacation you have to work extra before you take the time off. They also do not pay overtime.

job_title: Residential Youth Worker in Louisville, KY
pros: Working with the kids. Time seems to fly by when on the clock because sometimes your playing games, watching tv, or helping the kids get ready. Also the staff here is very friendly.
cons: Being kicked, punched, and spit on by the kids. Also, management puts in place unhelpful rules because they don't work with the kids or know what is going on in the cottages.

review_title: Unethical Work Environment & No Staff Support
job_title: Therapeutic Group Leader in Cincinnati, OH
pros: Making a difference and being a positive influence in children's lives.
cons: Had 6 different supervisors within my first 4 months of employment. If your good at what you do and your young, co-workers who have been with the company for over a few years will do whatever it takes to make your job even harder. Supervisors and upper level management is like talking to a wall, literally they were huge blockers stuck in the old ways afraid of change and never gave you the sense of trust. Negative interventions do not work in a negative environment.

pros: Benefits are okay, laidback at times, work with kids and make a difference. It’s a casual environment and good commodities with fellow staff.
cons: The change in  in the management has moved into the direction of thinking about only the money and that the children that we serve.

pros: This used to be a great place to work-- if we only recognized it then! The work was hard nut meaningful.
cons: New Director who is arrogant and loses his temper. Former supervisors are now managers who are failing and pointing blame at past managers and current employees. It is the highest turnover I have seen since I have worked here. This makes it unsafe for children and staff.

pros: Great Staff, Great Mission, Meaningful Work, Amazing Benefits Package, Caring Culture, Room for Advancement
cons: Not really any...I guess that we work with High Risk Youth, but that's why we do what we do(great training to prepare you though)

review_title: St. Joseph Orphanage - great place to make a difference!
job_title: Direct Care Staff in Cincinnati, OH
pros: Good professional experience, learning is encouraged and appriciated
cons: there can be a bit of compassion fatigue -

job_title: Clinical Case Manager in Cincinnati, OH
pros: Open to new ideas and are currently on the cutting edge of trauma informed methodologies.
cons: Dedication to efficient budgets tends to lead to large workloads. This has been changing however.

pros: Moral is good, benefits are good
cons: Management, started out as a bad place to work but has gotten better since new director came

pros: Freedom in my schedule, great mission, medical department really good. focused on what we need. Upper management listens
cons: Very busy, lots of change

review_title: Great place to work- not for everyone
pros: Rewarding, challenging, ability to serve, ability to grow
cons: Stressful, draining at times, some co-workers create unnecessary drama

pros: the people, the families, the mission and culture
cons: long hours, low pay, stressful and UR

job_title: Mental Health Education Intervention Specialist in Cincinnati, OH
pros: You gain a lot of experience quickly
cons: Not enough training. Poor facilities.

pros: Great team working toward a great cause!
cons: Motivating staff can become very difficult at times.

pros: Work with high risk children, making a difference in their everyday lives.
cons: Organization is dysfunctional and the workers are more childish than the children that need our services.

pros: Family like atmosphere with coworkers

Management terrible.
